revised_title: Experimental Researches on Magnecrystallic and Diamagnetic Phenomena
tldr: Faraday investigates the magnecrystallic and diamagnetic properties of various materials, including bismuth, titanium, copper, tin, lead, gold, tellurium, and several metallic compounds. He observes that some materials exhibit magnecrystallic phenomena, while others show only diamagnetic properties. Faraday also notes that the magnecrystallic axis plays a significant role in determining the orientation of these materials in a magnetic field.
